column1: Senate Democrats have again blocked hundreds of billions of dollars in COVID relief. Families and businesses are struggling. This senseless gridlock must stop for their sake. They deserve better. https://t.co/9MR7o7QGLa
Wishing the President @realDonaldTrump and First Lady Melania Trump @FLOTUS a speedy recovery. My thoughts and prayers are with all those impacted by #COVID19.

Proud to announce that @usedgov has awarded @MadeinAL over $17M. This investment was made possible by the CARES Act and will fund the Alabama Workforce Stabilization Program which will help provide educational & training opportunities for workers displaced by #COVID19. https://t.co/rANXhlttVY

Congress should act on a targeted #COVID19 relief measure to help small businesses and those in need. This will boost our economy and recovery efforts. Time is of the essence. We need to pass a measure now.
Today my colleagues & I introduced the HEALS Act - our plan to aid American families & businesses suffering from the #COVID19 global pandemic. I believe we need to act with a sense of urgency.

Today I attended the Labor-HHS Appropriations hearing to review Operation Warp Speed – our nation’s effort to find a safe effective #COVID19 vaccine. Questioned @NIHDirector @CDCDirector & @BARDA’s Dr. Disbrow on where we are in the process & when we can expect results. https://t.co/p2PMejrqYe

Proud @GovernorKayIvey is taking steps to ensure the safety of all Alabamians as we continue work to combat #COVID19. Please follow the #SaferatHome order through July 31st and continue wearing face masks and following @CDCGov guidelines. https://t.co/rICtlcErfQ

Important reminder for all small businesses in #Alabama! The deadline to apply for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram is Tuesday June 30th. Follow @SBAGov’s link below to apply now for assistance during #COVID19: https://t.co/QlcgDFyMWg
Additional #COVID19 resources are now available online for Alabama’s farmers: https://t.co/fuWlQCkZ2U

Reminder for all Alabamians: As we work together to safely reopen continue to adhere to @CDCgov’s #COVID19 safety measures. Please wear face masks practice social distancing & respect guidelines set by stores/businesses. You never know who may be at a greater risk. #TogetherAL https://t.co/PQgTPWRqTK

Today at the @BankingGOP hearing I questioned @FederalReserve Chairman Powell about the #economy jobs report & how we can resume business activity during & after #COVID19. Look forward to working together to get our economy back up and running efficiently & effectively.

Today is the 140th anniversary of US-Romanian diplomatic relations. Recently during the #COVID19 pandemic Romania deployed a medical team to #Alabama to provide medical reinforcements for hospitals nursing homes and long-term care facilities. I am grateful for their help.

SiO2 Materials Science in #Auburn is receiving $143M to accelerate production of their packaging platform for storing #coronavirus vaccines & therapeutics - adding 200 skilled manufacturing jobs. Proud this #Alabama company is working to combat #COVID19. https://t.co/bVE4LXx3lA

Encouraging news for #AL from @NIH: #UAB has been awarded $587941 to conduct a study to quantify undetected cases of #coronavirus infection. Proud @UABNews is continuing work to fight the negative effects of #COVID19.

Today @USDAFSA started accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. #CFAP will provide much-needed assistance to the farmers and ranchers in #Alabama and throughout the U.S. impacted by the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/oAYm5p45Xa

Encouraged to see the @DeptVetAffairs launched a new resource to assist #veterans & others across the nation during the #COVID19 crisis. Grateful the Department is working to relieve the stress and anxiety of those who may be struggling. https://t.co/84lLh0toxE

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram continues to assist many #smallbiz in #AL! As of May 8th 30647 loans amounting to $1525755462 were approved for #Alabama during the 2nd round of #PPP funding. Proud @SBAgov & @USTreasury are still working hard to provide #COVID19 relief.

This week is #NursesWeek! I want to thank all of the dedicated nurses throughout #AL & across the nation – not only for their selfless efforts during the #COVID19 crisis but also for their hard work & devotion to protecting & saving lives all the time.

Today @NOAA announced their plan to provide $300 million to assist the U.S. fishing industry in mitigating impacts caused by #COVID19. This includes $3.3M for #Alabama! I am proud to have fought to include this funding in the #CARESAct.

Today the @AlabamaNG will conduct a flyover to honor healthcare workers first responders and other essential employees for their efforts during the #COVID19 crisis. Proud these hardworking Alabamians are being recognized and commended! https://t.co/L54JDfwmQp

Happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek to all of AL's hardworking teachers. Proud of their efforts to invest in the lives & education of students – and especially grateful for their willingness to go above and beyond during #COVID19. Let’s take time this week to celebrate our #teachers.

Glad the Acting Secretary of @DHSGov Chad Wolf took the time to speak to @AuburnU students virtually today addressing the department’s response to the #COVID19 crisis & other current issues. Proud of the partnership that exists between #DHS & our state. https://t.co/LarG4FPRxC

Excellent news for 25 local #AL airports! @USDOT has awarded $61 million in @FAANews grants to support aviation #infrastructure improvements and allow operations to continue as they work to minimize the negative effects of #COVID19. https://t.co/dvemu1ER9d

Here’s a great opportunity for #AL students interested in #aviation: @FlightWorksAL is providing online education activities during the #COVID19 crisis. Visit https://t.co/LzRBFCvyn8 to be a part of it!

.@YMCAHuntsville’s Brown Bag Bus feeding program is delivering meals to children impacted by school closures in #Madison #Marshall & #Morgan counties due to #COVID19. The @YMCA is providing nearly 1000 meals each day that otherwise would have been supplied through school lunch. https://t.co/DOCkATDfcA

Excellent news for #AL & the nation: @POTUS has signed the #PaycheckProtectionProgram & Health Care Enhancement Act providing additional funding to assist small businesses & meet urgent healthcare needs of American families & workers during the #COVID19 public health pandemic.

Critical equipment to combat & prevent #COVID19 is being created & donated by @UAHuntsville. Glad the campus community is coming together to assist healthcare workers across the Tennessee Valley during this time. https://t.co/HakM1aci00

Spoke with @SenateMajLdr today. I believe widespread #COVID19 testing is the key to safely reopening the entire US economy. That is how we get out of this dilemma; not by spending trillions & trillions more. We cannot continue to rack up nat’l debt without knowing what’s working.

.@NSF awarded @AuburnU $200K to identify & validate antibodies to be used in #COVID19 biosensor devices. Proud to see #NSF investing in our efforts to combat this disease & prevent it from spreading. https://t.co/RgwfaO5UHq

Since its recent implementation the #PaycheckProtectionProgram has provided much-needed relief for many small businesses suffering from the effects of the #COVID19 crisis in #Alabama and across the nation.

More great news: @AltoProducts in #Atmore is retooling their manufacturing process from producing automotive clutches to N95 face shields. Proud to see this company stepping up during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/ZT11KrXvns
Inspiring news about @NissanofHoover helping #Hoover law enforcement combat #COVID19: https://t.co/b6ouHtJ9FI

More great news: @ProtectiveLife has pledged $1 million to #COVID19 relief efforts including support for @UABNews research & treatment development. Proud to see companies in #AL coming together during this crisis to help those in need. https://t.co/7ClvKOcvWc

AL is already feeling the impact of the #PaycheckProtectionProgram: as of last night 19244 loans have been approved amounting to $3819600518. Proud of the work @SBAgov @USTreasury & the Administration are doing to help combat the #COVID19 crisis in #AL & across the nation.
Great resource for small businesses in #Alabama that have questions regarding the #COVID19 pandemic: https://t.co/lzzE1sdJtK

Another great example of businesses in #AL doing all they can to combat #COVID19 and satisfy the needs of local communities during this time: Yellowhammer Brewing in #Huntsville decided to shift all production to make hand sanitizer! https://t.co/SAvpHK1E83

Proud to see #AL automakers working to make a difference during this emergency. Thanks @Toyota @Hyundai @MercedesBenz @Honda etc. for assisting with #COVID19 relief efforts by donating funds producing equipment and – in turn – saving lives. https://t.co/wEnX5Q8oOa

More resources are now available for Alabamians as we work to combat the effects of #COVID19! @GovernorKayIvey just launched #ALTogether – a site focused on providing additional information & assistance for those who need it. https://t.co/PosdJTh8Ii

Here’s another example of Alabamians working to fight this pandemic & help those suffering from it - A group of @AuburnU engineers has come up with an innovative way to treat #COVID19 patients by turning CPAP machines into ventilators. https://t.co/udPOFGcsXD

Proud to see @Hyundai @HopeonWheels is granting funding for #COVID19 drive-thru testing to 11 children's hospitals - one of them being @ChildrensAL. The hospital will receive a $200K grant to provide a safe & efficient way for children w/ risk factors to get the care they need. https://t.co/FzLiAOfYDy

It's of the utmost importance that Alabamians have access to the best resources to help fight this pandemic & receive proper care. Please visit my website for links to resources that’ll help AL utilize the funds from #CARESAct & other COVID-19 legislation: https://t.co/CAbsiUWfVq

AL’s main marine research center @DISeaLab is providing a unique opportunity for students teachers & the public to learn about all aspects of coastal & marine life. Despite schools being closed due to COVID-19 this is an experience everyone can enjoy. https://t.co/lwXgLZ2RSh
They are facing this catastrophe head-on and prioritizing our collective health and safety over their own. These are the unspoken heroes of the Coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/iaKVorZxow
Helpful resources from @BusinessDefense to help combat COVID-19: https://t.co/QrP8TvywP8

More good news: UAB was selected to participate in @NIH sponsored clinical trials in testing of the #UAB drug discovery #Remdesivir to help treat hospitalized patients with COVID-19. Proud we're working to fight this epidemic in #AL. @UABnews https://t.co/R0T3kjRdfy
Read my op-ed in the @MGMAdvertiser on the current Coronavirus emergency facing our nation: https://t.co/iaKVorZxow

Good news – in the midst of the COVID-19 emergency TVA is working to provide relief and flexibility for all 154 of its local power companies including those in Alabama. @TVAnews https://t.co/loDSlXQClH

Some good news in the midst of the COVID-19 crisis: @DeptofDefense just reported a successful test of a hypersonic glide body which paves the way for these to be built in #AL. These weapons will modernize our Armed Forces & improve our national defense. https://t.co/wGhPuoRubR

Another portion of the comprehensive CARES Act is the Keeping Workers Paid & Employed Act – a vital measure to protect our nation's small businesses. This $300B relief plan will help small businesses impacted by the Coronavirus pandemic make it through this crisis. #SmallBiz https://t.co/ogNGa1NLLz

Instead we are allowing the Treasury Secretary to make or guarantee collateralized loans to industries whose operations the Coronavirus outbreak has jeopardized. In my judgment this approach strikes an appropriate balance between providing assistance and protecting taxpayers.

Today I worked with my Senate colleagues to unveil a comprehensive economic response package to the COVID-19 outbreak – specifically legislation involving liquidity assistance for distressed American industries. https://t.co/F3tU0whHhj

The Senate remains in session this week working to pass monumental legislation to combat the Coronavirus & help the American people. In the meantime please visit my website for helpful information & resources related to COVID-19: https://t.co/w8nilIG10p

I urge everyone to be safe and practice the @CDCgov-recommended protocols. The Senate will continue to work next week on additional bipartisan legislation to combat the Coronavirus and protect our economy. Our top priority is the health and safety of the American people.

Pleased the Senate voted today to pass the #Coronavirus emergency supplemental package by a vote of 96-1 directing $8.3B in total resources to combat the virus at the local state federal and international levels amidst this urgent crisis.

Today we came to an agreement on a $7.767B Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Package to combat the #Coronavirus. We worked together to craft an aggressive and comprehensive response that provides the resources the experts say they need to combat this crisis.

Delivering remarks shortly on the Senate floor regarding the $7.767 billion #Coronavirus Emergency Supplemental. Tune in! This shouldn't be about politics; this is about doing our job to protect the American people. I urge my colleagues to support the package without delay.

Incredible that @UABnews has developed a drug used to treat select patients infected with the Coronavirus - both in the US and in China. This potential treatment is the result of research occurring in Alabama & could help save thousands around the world. https://t.co/glyQ2JqtKi

I just got off the phone with the President. He told me that his administration will not be sending any victims of the Coronavirus from the Diamond Princess cruise ship to Anniston Alabama. Thank you @POTUS for working with us to ensure the safety of all Alabamians.
